DOCNAME: CASE OF DZELADINOV AND OTHERS v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Procedural aspect)
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Renate Jaeger;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE , a group of GPE , who were leaving a restaurant where they had attended a NORP circumcision celebration , were involved in a fight with GPE , a wrestling champion who worked as a fitness instructor for the police force . PERSON reported the incident to the local police and around QUANTITY police officers went to the restaurant in search of the alleged attackers . When they entered the restaurant , they allegedly started to assault the guests .

CARDINAL . According to the applicants , they were beaten with truncheons , punched and kicked . The fifth applicant said that he was grabbed by the hair and beaten all over his body ; he was then handcuffed and taken to the police station where he was subjected to severe ill - treatment . The second applicant also complained that he had been beaten , despite his wife ’s attempts to protect him . The second and fourth applicants said that they were taken to a police station where they were kept for TIME and beaten by the police officers , who repeatedly insulted them on account of their ethnic origin .

CARDINAL . The third applicant was DATE pregnant when she was beaten in the restaurant . Following the raid , the police were asked to arrange for her to be taken to hospital , but refused . She somehow managed to get to the hospital , but the doctors refused to examine her when they found out that her assailants had been police officers . She said that she was severely distressed and in pain throughout the night . The following day , she was examined in the same hospital , but no injuries or problems were detected .
CARDINAL . It was alleged that CARDINAL other GPE asked for medical help TIME , but they were all turned down as they could not pay for treatment .

CARDINAL . DATE , in response to an earlier police summons , the first applicant went to the police station where he was allegedly beaten for TIME and insulted on account of his ethnic origin . He said that some QUANTITY police officers had hit him with a truncheon , and punched and kicked him . A gun had been held to his head , at which point he had falsely confessed to his involvement in the fight with GPE
CARDINAL . The applicants , in support of their application before the ORG , provided photographs of bruises on their backs , heads and buttocks .

CARDINAL . At TIME on CARDINAL DATE the police officers on duty received a telephone call saying that CARDINAL GPE , who had attended a circumcision party in a restaurant , had stopped a car and physically attacked the driver ( GPE ) . CARDINAL police officers went to the scene . After GPE had identified the first applicant as being among the attackers , the police officers requested him to leave the group and get into the police car . Although the police officers did nothing to provoke the group , CARDINAL GPE started to throw stones and bottles causing facial injuries to CARDINAL of the officers . The police car was also damaged . As the police officers were prevented from arresting the first applicant , who had fled the scene , and as they feared for their own safety , they radioed for backup . CARDINAL of the officers fired QUANTITY shots in the air to disperse the crowd . A patrol of CARDINAL more officers arrived at the scene . Another QUANTITY shots were fired in the air .

CARDINAL . As these attempts to restore order proved unsuccessful , the police officers used batons . After the crowd had been broken up , the police took various people , including the second and fifth applicants , to the police station . After being questioned about the assault on GPE , the second and fifth applicants were released . It was established that they had been among the crowd , but had not been involved in the physical attack on GPE No force was used against them at the police station . According to the medical records of ORG , none of the persons apprehended or involved in the fight had requested medical assistance as a result of the police intervention . On the other hand , QUANTITY police officers had been examined and QUANTITY of them were found to have sustained minor injuries .

CARDINAL . According to the medical records , at the request of a pregnant woman , a medical team had gone to the scene and brought her to the hospital . An entry in the hospital ’s medical records of CARDINAL DATE showed that CARDINAL ORG or PERSON had been “ urgently ” admitted with bruising to the head . CARDINAL doctors , a surgeon and a gynaecologist , had examined her and a note had been made in the record : “ no funds – fight ” . No injuries to the foetus or other pregnancy - related trauma were detected . On DATE the same findings were recorded by another doctor in the medical records of ORG , who , it was noted , had frequently requested medical assistance in the past for injuries sustained in fights and had sustained a black eye on the most recent occasion . An eyewitness to the incident stated that a pregnant woman had hit a police officer over the head with a bottle .
CARDINAL . The Government based their version of events on a number of police reports that had been compiled DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the chief of the local police drew up a report concerning the coercive measures that had been used during the incident . It reads , inter alia , as follows :

“ ... on DATE a phone call was received [ to the effect ] that GPE had been physically attacked by a group of GPE ... Mr S. , Mr A. and Mr M. [ police officers ] arrived at the scene ... GPE identified CARDINAL of the attackers ... he was requested to get into the police car . The person concerned came forward without resisting ... , but when a van arrived ... the crowd attacked it , started to drag Mr S. and Mr M. ... they started to throw stones , bottles and other objects at the officers and the police car . The suspect fled ... Backup was immediately requested ; CARDINAL police officers arrived after TIME ... CARDINAL people threw stones , bottles and other items ... police officers GPE , ORG and ORG were hit ... Physical force and rubber batons were used against several GPE by the officers FAC , GPE , GPE , GPE , ORG , ORG , ORG , GPE and GPE ... because the crowd continued to throw stones and other objects at the officers despite warnings ( CARDINAL shots fired in the air ) ... ”

CARDINAL . In the telegram , the police described the incident and stated that CARDINAL people , including the second and fifth applicants , had been brought to the police station for questioning . It said that QUANTITY police officers had sustained minor injuries in the intervention in which stones and bottles had been thrown at the police officers .

CARDINAL . In a document of CARDINAL DATE , the PERSON police indicated that according to the statement of an eyewitness , the incident had caused considerable alarm . This is how the eyewitness described the incident :

“ ... my wife and I were extremely unnerved by the incident and the intensity of the attack by the GPE , first , against the occupant of the car [ referring to GPE ] , and then against the police officers who had done nothing to anger the crowd . It was simply that the savage nature [ of the attack ] was clear to see and incited by an inebriated group of people who had been celebrating a circumcision ... ”
CARDINAL . Concerning the use of coercive measures , the report stated , inter alia :

“ ... it is considered that the use of rubber batons was justified for the following reasons : [ there had been an ] unmotivated and brutal attack on GPE ; the authorised officers had been prevented from carrying out an official activity , i.e. identifying the perpetrator of an offence , although no coercive measures had been used against the person concerned or anyone else ; the life and physical integrity of the authorised officers had been endangered by a sustained attack which was liable to cause grievous bodily harm or fatal injury ; officials were injured and a police car damaged ; orders by the police officers were disobeyed and the attack had continued even after shots were fired in the air ... ”
CARDINAL . The document continued :

“ ... some [ sections of the ] media and ORG associations are minimising or ignoring the objective circumstances and the responsibility of the perpetrators and the individual involvement of each of the participants in the group , tendentiously asserting that the police targeted the GPE population , whereas they were not influenced by the ORG ethnic affiliation , but merely responded to the concrete circumstances of the incident ... ”
CARDINAL . It was further noted that a group of CARDINAL GPE and PERSON , a former member of ORG , had gathered outside the local police station afterwards .
CARDINAL . PERSON , GPE ’s wife , who was in the car at the time of the incident stated , inter alia :

“ ... Meanwhile , CARDINAL of the participants went to the restaurant where the GPE were holding a wedding party and most probably told lies [ about the incident ] . A large group of people came out of the restaurant causing total chaos . When the officers got out of the car , they started throwing stones and other objects . A horse cart was standing nearby and a man gave wooden sticks to the group to use against the police . I would stress that women and children stood in front of the officers with the men behind . There was a pregnant woman among the group of people . My husband took her out of the group so that she would not be injured ; he stopped a car which took her to the city hospital ... ”
CARDINAL . The first applicant stated , inter alia :

“ ... While he [ the police officer ] was taking me to the police van , a scuffle started as many people gathered around . At that moment , the police officers fired CARDINAL shots in the air to disperse the crowd . I did not see any stones , bottles or pieces of wood being thrown at the van . When the officer released my arm , he launched himself at the group with a truncheon . I escaped and went home ... ”
CARDINAL . Describing the circumstances concerning the fight with GPE , the fourth applicant stated , inter alia :
“ ... while I was pulling PERSON aside , PERSON punched me once in the face ... I think that there were CARDINAL people at the scene ... ”
CARDINAL . The fourth applicant stated , inter alia :

“ ... It is not true that he [ GPE ] did not hit anyone . He hit me with his elbow in the chest and punched me in the left eye . I felt intense pain , I found a bottle and struck GPE over the head ... I had blood in my eye from GPE ’s punch and could not see ... ”

CARDINAL . PERSON identified the first applicant as CARDINAL of the attackers of her husband , describing him as a person “ with long hair and dressed in black ” . The first applicant confirmed that he had long hair and had been wearing black clothes .
CARDINAL . Mr GPE , an eyewitness , stated , inter alia :

“ ... a large group of GPE gathered ... they started to throw stones and bottles at the police officers who had arrived at the scene . I think that CARDINAL of the officers concerned fired to restore order ... ”
CARDINAL . PERSON , an eyewitness , stated , inter alia :
“ ... GPE firstly hit NORP [ the fourth applicant ] in the eye and then NORP hit him with a bottle on the back of the head ... ”
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG filed a criminal complaint against QUANTITY persons , including the first and fourth applicants , for assault .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor lodged an indictment with the court alleging assault ( насилство ) on GPE under LAW . It was noted in the indictment , inter alia , that around a CARDINAL people had witnessed the incident .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Instance found the first and fourth applicants guilty of taking part in the fight and sentenced them to CARDINAL and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment respectively . It acquitted a co - defendant , PERSON , as he had attempted to separate those involved . The court admitted a considerable amount of evidence including oral evidence from the accused , GPE and his wife ; evidence from CARDINAL eyewitnesses and CARDINAL doctors concerning GPE ’s injuries ; and a medical certificate of CARDINAL DATE on GPE The court established that PERSON , CARDINAL of the accused , had left the restaurant at TIME While under the influence of alcohol he had gone out into the street and stopped the car in which GPE and his wife were travelling . PERSON had immediately started to bang on the car . When GPE got out , PERSON had attacked him with his fists and kicked him . Shortly afterwards , the first and fourth applicants had joined in , battering GPE with their fists and a glass bottle and kicking him all over his body . GPE had sustained injuries to his head , cuts to his finger and elbow , bruising to his face and damage to CARDINAL teeth . The court rejected the first applicant ’s defence that he had not been involved in the quarrel as contrary to the evidence . It found the fourth applicant ’s argument that he had been involved in the fight with GPE because the latter had hit him in the eye unsubstantiated , as no evidence or medical certificate had been produced in support of that allegation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance decision became final as no appeal had been lodged within the statutory time - limit . According to the applicants , they had not appealed against the decision because the trial judge ’s lack of sympathy with their allegations of ill - treatment and repeated intimidation by the police gave them little hope that they would have any prospect of success on appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants filed a criminal complaint ( кривична пријава ) for torture with the PERSON public prosecutor ’s office ( Основно Јавно Обвинителство Штип ) against ORG . It was stated in the complaint that after the fight with GPE a large group of police officers had arrived and beaten the guests in the restaurant with their truncheons and fists and kicked them . The applicants alleged that some of the guests had been tied up and beaten at the police station the following day . They also complained that the officers concerned had used force to extract confessions from some of them concerning their involvement in the fight with GPE They said that they had produced photographs and a medical certificate in support of that allegation . They also invited the public prosecutor to take statements .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants provided the public prosecutor with further photographs as evidence of the police abuse .
CARDINAL . On DATE they submitted written statements about the events .
CARDINAL . The first applicant stated , inter alia :
“ ... [ after my release from custody ] I wanted to see a doctor , but assumed that , as with the others , I would not be admitted to the hospital . We have all had to put up with the pains ... ”
CARDINAL . After being taken to hospital after the incident , the third applicant stated , inter alia :
“ ... a gynaecologist examined me and sent me home . He told me to visit a doctor on the following DATE ... ”
CARDINAL . The fourth applicant stated , inter alia :

“ ... After I was released from custody , I went to ORG as I felt unbearable pains all over my body . There , they refused to give me medical care as I had no funds . I was told that ( medical services ) for injuries sustained in a fight have to be paid for ... ”
DATE . The fifth applicant stated , inter alia :

“ ... [ after his release from custody ] ... After TIME , I went to the Štip Medical Centre because of the unbearable pains all over my body . They did not want to examine me , nor did they issue a medical certificate as I had no funds to pay [ for treatment ] ... ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the local public prosecutor ’s office requested information concerning the incident from ORG through the ORG public prosecutor ’s office . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor ’s office transmitted this request to ORG . On DATE the local police submitted to the central police authority all the material relating to the incident .
CARDINAL . As the local public prosecutor failed to respond to the ORG complaint for DATE , the ORG representative wrote to the Minister of the ORG on DATE informing him about the case .
CARDINAL . As they did not receive a reply from the ORG or the local public prosecutor , on DATE the applicants sent another letter to the latter enquiring about the progress of their case .
CARDINAL . In a letter dated DATE the local public prosecutor replied that on DATE his office had requested ORG to take steps to identify the offenders , but had not received a reply .

CARDINAL . The applicants received no information or acknowledgement about the action that had been taken by the competent national prosecuting authorities in relation to their complaint of torture by police officers .
